text: The Women's 3000 metres event at the 2005 European Athletics Indoor Championships was held on March 4–6. ==Medalists== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:left" |- align="center" | width=200 bgcolor=gold|Gold||width=200 bgcolor=silver|Silver|| width=200 bgcolor=CC9966|Bronze |- |Lidia Chojecka '''' |Susanne Pumper '''' |Sabrina Mockenhaupt '''' |} Note: Turkey's Tezeta Desalegn-Dengersa originally won the silver medal but was later disqualified for doping offence (metenolone). ==Results== ===Heats=== First 4 of each heat (Q) and the next 4 fastest (q) qualified for the final. {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center" |- !Rank !!
